snippet: G.M. has been sued, and now faces an investigation by the safety agency and the possibility of a criminal investigation, similar to the criminal inquiry Toyota is facing after recalls over the unintended acceleration of its vehicles.
abstract: General Motors recalls nearly 1.4 million cars, saying ignition switch can shut off car's engine and electrical system, and disable its air bags; automaker has been sued and now faces investigation by National Highway Traffic Safety Administration after decade-long inaction that led to trail of fatal crashes; GM also faces possibility of criminal investigation, similar to criminal inquiry Toyota is facing after recalls over unintended acceleration of its vehicles
lead_paragraph: G.M. has been sued, and now faces an investigation by the safety agency and the possibility of a criminal investigation, similar to the criminal inquiry Toyota is facing after recalls over the unintended acceleration of its vehicles.

headline.main: In General Motors Recalls, Inaction and Trail of Fatal Crashes
headline.print_headline: In G.M. Recalls, Inaction and a Trail of Fatal Crashes

keywords.value: Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corp
keywords.name: organizations
